Row.Text: Builders receive an additional charge. Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Gondor unique anti-cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Citadel Guard adjacent.
Gives 3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and 1 Points for Great Generals.

Likes peaceful civilizations that have a city on his home continent. Hates civilizations starting wars against a city-state or civilization based on his continent. Likes civilizations who are their declared friend. Hates civilizations who backstab and declare surprise wars.
Receive a second Rohirrim unit each time you train a Rohirrim unit. All Pastures gain 1 [ICON_Culture].
+300% flanking bonus. All Cavalry Units push enemys back if they are victorious in combat. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Rohan unique cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against melee units and heal after defeating an enemy.
Rohan unique ranged cavalry unit. Can move after attacking.

+40% combat experience for all cavalry class units trained in this city. May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Barracks. 1 [Icon_Production] Production and 2 Points for Great Generals.
Likes civilizations who are willing to form a long-term alliance. Dislikes anyone denouncing or attacking his friends and allies.
All their units do not suffer combat penalties when damaged. Double the Points for Great Artists, Musicians and Writers. -10% less City Growth than usual.

May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles. Additional Diplomatic policy slot.
Eldar elves unique melee unit that replace Swordman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee and Cavalry units.
Eldar elves unique light cavalry unit that replace Horseman. Can move after attacking.
Eldar elves unique anti-cavalry unit that replace Pikeman. Receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast.
Eldar elves unique ranged unit that replace Crossbowman. More ranged, combat and range attack. Receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for fighting next to a Noldor Warrior or a Mithlond Sentry.
Eldar elves unique building that replace the Workshop. Gives 2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, 2 [ICON_Production] Production, 1 Point for a Great Generals.
Likes peaceful civilizations that have a city on his home continent. Hates civilizations starting wars against a city-state or civilization based on his continent.

All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle. +1 Faith[ICON_Faith] in the Holy Sites next to Forests. Extra appeal next to forests. Units heal faster in forest or jungles. -10% less City Growth than usual.
All units are cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it. +1 Gold[ICON_Gold] in the Commercial Hubs next to Forests.
Silvan elves unique anti-cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] against cavalry.
Silvan elves unique ranged unit that replace Crossbowman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Silvan Spearman adjacent.
Gives 2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, 2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, 1 [ICON_Housing] Housing and 2 Points for Great Artists.
>Dislikes civilizations that remove features. Likes Civilizations if they plant forests, perserve features.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government. All units are cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it.
Silvan elves of Lorien unique ranged unit that replace Crossbowman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least another Galadhrim Archer adjacent.
Dislikes civilizations that remove features and start wars. Likes Civilizations if they plant forests, perserve features and dont go to war.

Industrials Zones gains 1 [ICON_Production] Production and the Commercial Hubs gains 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold if they are next to a Mountain. All mines gives 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, 1 [ICON_Production] Production and 1 [ICON_Food] Food.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee units. All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post.
Dwarven unique Medieval era melee unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Dwarven unique Medieval era anti-cavalry unit.+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Dwarven Phalanxes adjacent.
Dwarven unique Medieval era light cavalry unit. +5 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and can move over Hills faster.
Dwarven unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit. +50% flanking bonus and +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking ranged and siege units.
Dwarven unique building that replace the Workshop. Gives 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, 2 [ICON_Production] Production, 2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, 2 Point for a Great Engineer and 2 Point for a Great Merchant.
Tries to have the highest possible [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn income. Respects other high income civilizations.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward Encampment districts and Barrack for that district. Capture unit enemies as Builders. Desert terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations.
Additional Military policy slot. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual. Unit maintenance cost reduced by 2 Gold per turn, per unit. Gains an extra Morannon Orc when trained one.
Mordor unique melee unit. Reduced pillage cost.
Orc unique Medieval era melee unit. Stronger than Swordmans and does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Orc unique Medieval era Heavy cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against damaged units.
Orc unique Medieval era ranged cavalry unit. Can move after attacking.
Mordor unique Medieval unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee units.
Orc unique improvement. Gives 1 [ICON_Food] Food, 1 [ICON_Production] Production and 1 Housing. Can be build in all terrains.
Focuses on Production. Likes civilizations that have a large standing army and likes going to war. Dislikes peaceful civilizations and those that have a small standing army.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.
Gains an extra Uruk-Hai when trained one. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Isengard unique Medieval era melee unit. Stronger than Pikeman and does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Isengard unique Medieval era melee unit. +7 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking, and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Isengard unique Medieval era melee unit. Reduced pillage cost.
Focuses on Production. Likes Civilizations that have lots of improved tiles and focus on production. Dislikes civilizations that have low production a low amount of improved tiles.
+25% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient and Classical era melee and ranged units.Builders receive an additional charge.
Industrials Zones gains 1 [ICON_Production] Production if they are next to a Mountain. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Goblin unique melee unit. Reduced pillage cost.
Goblin unique ranged unit. Reduced pillage cost.
Goblin unique melee unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hills.
Goblin unique Medieval unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee units.
Goblin unique improvement. Gives 2 [ICON_Food] Food, 1 [ICON_Production] Production, 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 1 Housing. Can only be build in hills.

Focuses on Production, likes Civilizations that focus on production and dislikes civilizations that have low production. Sympathizes with the barbarians. Does not like civilizations that destroy barbarian outposts. Does not care about the warmongering of other civilizations.
Commercial Hubs gives 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 1 [ICON_Food] Food per adjacency to Desert or Desert Hills.Desert terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Desert and Plains.
Harad unique unit. -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all adjacent enemy units.
Harad unique unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's.

+40% combat experience for all melee and ranged land units trained in this city. Gives 2 [ICON_Production] Production, 2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, 1 [ICON_Food] Food , 2 Points for Great Generals and 1 Housing.

Likes civilizations who have the same Luxury resources as he does, and will try to collect every Luxury resource available. Dislikes civilizations who have a new Luxury resource he has not yet collected.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Military units receive +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each different Luxury resource improved in Umbar lands.
Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast. Allows coastal raiding for all naval melee units.
Medieval era ranged naval unit with the ability to coastal raid. Cannot be seen unless adjacent to it.
Gives 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, 2 Points for Great Almirals, 1 Housing and +25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city.
Likes civilizations who are her declared friend. Likes civilizations who backstab and declare surprise wars.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Rhûn. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Rhûn provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Rhûn.All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post.

+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states.Combat units have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Rhûn unique anti-cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting against cavalry.
Rhûn unique heavy cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength outside of own borders.
Likes civilizations that have a large standing army and likes going to war. Dislikes peaceful civilizations and those that have a small standing army.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Khand. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Desert and Plains.
Other civilizations [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Khand provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Khand. Capture unit enemies as Builders.
Khand unique cavalry unit. Yields 60% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] as [ICON_Gold] on combat victory.
Khand unique ranged cavalry unit. Can move after attacking.
Khand unique cavalry unit. This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Likes to see civilizations at war, and believes in constant struggle.
Extra territory upon founding cities. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra.

+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's. When Greek units are victorious in combat, receive Culture equal to 50% of the defeated unit's base strength. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Angmar unique anti-cavalry unit that replace the Pikemen. +5 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and can move over Hills faster.
Angmar unique Medieval era melee unit. +5 Combat Strength when fighting in Tundra and Snow.
Angmar and Arnor unique Medieval anti-cavalry unit that replace the Spearmen. +5 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and can move over Hills faster.
Angmar unique Medieval ranged unit that replace the Crossbowman. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when there is an Apostle, Inquisitor, or Missionary in the same hex.
Angmar unique building. Gives 4 [ICON_Faith] Faith, 1 [ICON_Science] Science and 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Likes civilizations who follow the same Religion, and wants his cities to all follow the same Religion. Hates anyone trying to spread their Religion into his empire.

When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost. Builders receive an additional charge. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles.

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. If in [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range of your [ICON_Capital] Capital, they also start with a road to it. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities. All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Heroic Statue building in the Ancient era).
Arnor unique ranged unit. This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Arnor and Gondor unique building that improve the Medieval Walls.
Arnor and Gondor unique building available after researching Castles. Gives more defenece, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 Point for Great Generals.
Likes civilizations who are willing to form a long-term alliance. Dislikes anyone denouncing or attacking his friends and allies.

100% Production toward Ancient, Classical, Renaissance and Industrial era naval units. +100% Harbor district adjacency bonuses. Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching Shipbuilding.
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points.
Gondor unique ranged/recon unit. This unit is invisible unless adjacent enemies are next this units.
Gondor unique heavy cavalry unit. +5 Combat Strength when attacking ranged and siege units.
Gondor unique ranged unit. +5 Combat Strength when in a district or fort.
Mordor and Angmar unique Recon unit that replace the Ranger but can be obtain earlier. 2x flanking bonus.
Mordor and Angmar unique Recon unit. -5 to adjacent enemies.
Mordor and Goblins unique anti-cavalry unit. Reduced pillage cost.
Mordor unique ranged unit. Less attack than normal but +1 additional attack if unit has not moved.
Mordor unique cavalry unit that doesn't replace any unit. +5 Combat Strength against damaged units.
Dwarf unique ranged unit. +10 Combat Strength when defending vs. melee class units.
Dwarf unique heavy cavalry. Can move after attacking.
Rohan unique ranged unit. Cheaper but with less Combat Strength than the Crossbowman which replace.
Isengard unique ranged unit. +7 Combat Strength vs. units in districts
Rhûn unique ranged unit. Adjacent units of a different class get +10 Combat Strength vs. cavalry.
Silvan unique melee unit. +7 Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh.
Noldor unique heavy cavalry unit .+10 combat bonus vs. melee units.
Eldar elfs unique light cavalry unit.+5 Combat Strength when attacking ranged and siege units.
Eldar elfs unique ranged cavalry unit. Can move after attacking.
Noldor unique ranged unit. +10 Combat Strength when defending vs. melee class units.
Noldor unique anti-cavalry unit. +7 combat bonus when defending.
Elfs ranged naval unit. Stronger range strength than normal.
Umbar unique melee unit. Reduced pillage cost and doens't need Iron to reclut.
Elfs unique Recon unit. -5 to adjacent enemies.
Elfs unique siege unit. Stronger than the catapult and +5 Combat Strength in the woods.
Teleri unique melee unit .+7 defense vs. ranged attacks.
Lainquendi Elfs unique ranged unit. +7 Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh.
Vanyar Elfs unique spearman unit. +7 when attacking melee and ranged units.
Edain unique anti-cavalry unit. No penalty for lost health.
Numenor unique ranged unit that replace Crossbowman. Receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast.
Morgoth unique melee unit. +10 when fighting on Hills.
Morgoth unique heavy cavalry unit. Heals every turn.
Morgoth unique melee unit. -5 to adjacent enemies.
Morgoth unique unit. -5 to adjacent enemies and can attack the city walls.
Morgoth unique unit. -5 to adjacent enemies, +7 Combat Strength vs. units in districts and can attack the city walls.
Morgoth unique recon unit. +5 Combat Strength against damaged units.
Unique elf building in the city center. It gives some defence, +1 Housing, +8 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture adjacency for woods. Can only be built in the capital.
A building unique to Dwarves. Raises the strength of your outer defenses. Gives +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1[ICON_Culture] Culture.
Unique dwarven building in the city center. +1 Housing, +6 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Food] Food.

Unique orc militar building. +1 Housing, +2 [ICON_Production] Production. +35% combat experience for all melee and ranged land units trained in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Stable.

Elven unique improvement. Gives 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if next to another elven tower. Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.
Elven unique improvement. Gives 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if next to a river. +1[ICON_Faith] Faith if next to a Forest.
Harad unique improvement. Gives 1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production. +2[ICON_Gold] Gold for adjacency to Mines or Quarries. Can only be build on plains or deserts.
Dislikes civilizations that start wars. Likes Civilizations if they don't go to war.
Sympathizes with the barbarians. Does not like civilizations that destroy barbarian outposts. Does not care about the warmongering of other civilizations.
